name: Spicy Tofu Peas stuffed Naan Calzones
description: Vegan Naan Calzone stuffed with Spicy tofu and peas scramble and vegan cheese. Easy carry out lunch. Vegan Nut-free Corn-free Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1/8 tsp kala namak/Indian black salt for the eggy taste (optional)
14 oz pack firm Tofu (crumbled. I use Nasoya organic non gmo)
a very generous dash of black pepper
lemon juice and cilantro for garnish
nigella seeds and vegan butter as needed for the calzones

recipeInstructions.text: Preprare the Naan dough and let it sit to rise for an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Preprare the Naan dough and let it sit to rise for an hour.

recipeInstructions.text: Tofu Pea Scramble:Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add cumin seeeds and cook for a minute or until they change color. Add onions, chili and garlic and cook until just about translucent. 3-4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Tofu Pea Scramble:Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add cumin seeeds and cook for a minute or until they change color. Add onions, chili and garlic and cook until just about translucent. 3-4 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add spices and mix well. Add tomato, water and nutritional yeast, mix and cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until tomatoes are saucy.
recipeInstructions.name: Add spices and mix well. Add tomato, water and nutritional yeast, mix and cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until tomatoes are saucy.

recipeInstructions.text: Mash/crumble the tofu with hands or chop small and add to the pan. Add the peas. Mix well, cover and cook for 5 minutes. If the scramble begins to stick, deglaze with a Tbsp of water. I don’t press the Tofu before use, so usually there is enough moisture to prevent sticking.
recipeInstructions.name: Mash/crumble the tofu with hands or chop small and add to the pan. Add the peas. Mix well, cover and cook for 5 minutes. If the scramble begins to stick, deglaze with a Tbsp of water. I don’t press the Tofu before use, so usually there is enough moisture to prevent sticking.

recipeInstructions.text: Taste and adjust salt and spice. Lower the heat to low-medium and cook for another 3-5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Taste and adjust salt and spice. Lower the heat to low-medium and cook for another 3-5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle black pepper, lemon juice and cilantro(optional) and keep aside to cool.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle black pepper, lemon juice and cilantro(optional) and keep aside to cool.

recipeInstructions.text: Make Calzones: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc. Divide the dough into 7 to 8 pieces. Roll each piece into a circle.
recipeInstructions.name: Make Calzones: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc. Divide the dough into 7 to 8 pieces. Roll each piece into a circle.

recipeInstructions.text: Place tofu and pea scramble on half the circle. Add vegan cheese shreds of choice. Drizzle a little bbq sauce or sriracha or mango chutney other sauce of choice (optional). Fold the other half over to form a half moon and seal with a fork. Shape all the calzones and place on parchment lined baking sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Place tofu and pea scramble on half the circle. Add vegan cheese shreds of choice. Drizzle a little bbq sauce or sriracha or mango chutney other sauce of choice (optional). Fold the other half over to form a half moon and seal with a fork. Shape all the calzones and place on parchment lined baking sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray water generously on the calzones. Sprinkle nigella seeds and press in.Let them sit for 5 to 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray water generously on the calzones. Sprinkle nigella seeds and press in.Let them sit for 5 to 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 11 to 14 minutes or until golden. Brush melted vegan butter and serve with marinara, mango chutney or other sauce/dip of choice.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 11 to 14 minutes or until golden. Brush melted vegan butter and serve with marinara, mango chutney or other sauce/dip of choice.
